channel.title: Static animation #3!
channel.description:
Hey, ive noticed that my Static Animation, always face south.. Like my dds spec, the animation always goes to the south of the player, not the way they are facing.
Anyone know a fix?
Much apreciated
--
Please no posts, like "make it hit the player/npc using coords" "i have this problem aswell!" "i dont think u can fix it"
You can fix it, because ive seen it on servers.. Please sum1?
P.S ~
I know this may be complex stuff... As some people have said. But what im looking for is.. A quick explanation, on what i would do..
You guys are saying, make the special follow the player, and im thinking. Wtf are you dumb?!?!... READ MY POST!.. I'm asking HOW, not for some guy to not read the whole post, just the title.. And post something like "make the dds special follow the coords of the player" ..
That may well be right, but im asking HOW?
P.S.S ~
I'm sorry to keep posting, but every night, i leave for about 9 hours. I come back in the morning, and my post is on page 5-7.. And i dont like to keep bumping it. So i made a new one.
-
[b][i]Read B4 Posting[/i][/b]

item.title: Static animation #3!
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“spankjava, post:7, topic:152860”]you need to add this int into your void so it would be this

public void staticAnimation(int graphicID, int Face, int playerX, int playerY, int heightLevel)
{
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players)
{
if(p != null) 
{
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null"))
{
if(person.distanceToPoint(playerX, playerY) <= 10)
{
person.staticAnimation2(graphicID, playerX, playerY, heightLevel);
}
}
}
}
}

so it would now be

staticAnimation(347, Way to face, absX, absY-1, 100);

the way is faces is this

//FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH[/quote]

Ya dat was kinda helpful, but dude, i want it facing the PLAYER… Not a set point… Which ever way im facing, i want it to spec infront of me

Read full topic

item.title: Static animation #3!
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Well every server i’ve seen, has this feature. I’ve even gone to their server source. Taken out those methods, and their special method, and tried to see if it would work in a Pimpscape source. So it did… And again, the specials r facing south…

So its something im missing, or that method[br][size=1]Posted on: October 20, 2007, 03:44:20 AM[/size][hr][quote=“sanga282, post:5, topic:152860”]in Fedexer’s global object thing there should be a void or method or int or somthing that dictates which way something faces check there[/quote]

Link me?

item.title: Static animation #3!
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

public void staticAnimation(int graphicID, int playerX, int playerY, int heightLevel)
{
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players)
{
if(p != null) 
{
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null"))
{
if(person.distanceToPoint(playerX, playerY) <= 10)
{
person.staticAnimation2(graphicID, playerX, playerY, heightLevel);
}
}
}
}
}


public void staticAnimation2(int graphicID, int playerX, int playerY, int heightLevel) { /*Used from phates old stuff*/
		outStream.createFrame(85);
		outStream.writeByteC(playerY - (mapRegionY * 8));
		outStream.writeByteC(playerX - (mapRegionX * 8));
		outStream.createFrame(4);
		outStream.writeByte(0);				
		outStream.writeWord(graphicID);			//	Graphic ID
		outStream.writeByte(heightLevel);		//	Height above gorund
		outStream.writeWord(0);					//	Pause before casting
	}

Read full topic
